remarks: Initial objects are essentially unique (strong form), i.e. there is a _unique_ isomorphism between two initial objects, see statement in [Lang] p. 58 ("... if P, P' are two universal objects [[...] then there exists a unique isomorphism between them.".  (Proposed by BJ, 14-Apr-2020.)  (Contributed by AV, 14-Apr-2020.)

initoeu1.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( InitO ` C ) ) $.
initoeu1 $p |- ( ph -> E! f f e. ( A ( Iso ` C ) B ) ) $.
